required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Soccer Play in Children With Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Soccer Play in Children With Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock:
1. To figure out the effect of soccer play (once a week for 8 weeks) on pulmonary function in children with cerebral palsy
2. To find out if the leisure activity (soccer) increase the quality of life, motor function, gait function etc..
3. Safety of soccer play in children with cerebral palsy

detailed_description.textblock:
1. 1 hr of play once a week for 8 weeks of soccer program was done in the experimental group.
2. Both the experimental and control group were children with ambulatory cerebral palsy aged 5 to 12 years.
3. Several outcomes were measured before and after the program
- pulmonary function test including FVC, FEV1
- GMFM-88, PBS, walking test, muscle power sprint test, timed up and go, gait parameters
- Child Health Questionnaire Parent Form 50 (CHQ-PF50)
- KIDSCREEN
4. An accelerometer was worn before the program and during the program for a week (experimental group only)

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: all were ambulatory children with CP age 5-12 years old.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of FVC after soccer program
primary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of gross motor function after soccer program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of balance after soccer program1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of balance after soccer program2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of anaerobic test after soccer program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of physical activity with soccer program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and during the program (about 3-4 weeks interval)
secondary_outcome.description: wear an accelerometer for a week

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval
before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of FEV1 after soccer program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the program, up to 10 weeks interval
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1, forced expiratory volume in 1 second (L)

arm_group.description: children who participated in soccer play program usual activity and therapy + soccer play program (once a week for eight weeks)
children without soccer paly program usual activity and therapy

intervention.description: once a week for an hour of a soccer program for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children with cerebral palsy
- GMFCS level I-II
- 5-12 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute disease, less than 6 months from the surgery
- the behavioral or psychiatric problem that hinders group activity
- intellectual disability to do the questionnaire
- who do not participate in the class well (absent more than 3 times)

overall_official.affiliation: St. Vincent's hospital, The Catholic University of Korea
